summarize top compliance failures.title: Top Compliance Failures Summary
summarize top compliance failures.body:
Based on your test results, I found 2 critical compliance failures:

1. **FHIR Resource Structure** (TC002) - Missing required 'resourceType' field in observation records
2. **Reference Integrity** (TC005) - Broken reference to Patient/unknown-id in Observation

These failures affect data interoperability and could lead to integration issues with other healthcare systems. I recommend prioritizing the resourceType field fixes first.

how to fix the failures.title: Remediation Recommendations
how to fix the failures.body:
Here's how to fix the identified failures:

**For TC002 (FHIR Structure):**
```json
{
  "resourceType": "Observation",
  "id": "obs-001",
  // ... rest of your data
}
```

**For TC005 (Reference Integrity):**
- Verify all patient IDs exist before referencing
- Use valid patient references like "Patient/patient-001"
- Implement reference validation in your data pipeline

**For TC003 (Date Format):**
- Standardize all dates to ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ)
